newsitem.title: ARGENTINA: Argentine bonds higher, boosted by U.S. data.
newsitem.headline: Argentine bonds higher, boosted by U.S. data.

text.p: Argentine bonds were higher late morning Thursday, boosted by U.S. Treasuries after the release of as expected U.S. July industrial output figures and July consumer price figures.
"The market is strong but there is not much going on," said a trader at a local bank.
Argentina's Par Brady bond was up 1/4 at 74-1/4. The FRB bond rose 1/8 to 95-3/4.
Traders said Thursday's general strike called by the CTA and MTA opposition unions was not having any negative affect on markets.
"This strike is having no impact whatever. The only thing maybe is that there is less volume," said another trader.
